 Returns the user state, connected or not ?

 Returns the user name.

 Returns the method that was used to authenticate the user.

 Shows the authentification box, use it where you need it in the page.

Protected Member Functions

 showLink ()
 Shows a link so the user can disconnect.
 showForm ()
 Shows the authentification form.
 validate ($login, $password)
 Actually does the authentification, calling all the plugins until one recognizes the user, then store its name to later use it to disconnect the user.
 autoAuth ()
 Try to automatically authenticate against all plugin that support autoAuth (like Cas, Ssl), that is, that can authenticate the user without providing login/password.
 connect ($userName)
 Saves the "connected" state and username in session vars The user will remain logged in until the disconnect() method is used.
 disconnect ()
 Disconnects the user by killing the relevant session vars.
 loadPlugins ($pluginPath)
 Loads all the auth plugins and stores them into a member array, in order to call them when needed (Typically in the validate() method).

Protected Attributes

 $connected
 Is the user connected ?
 $userName
 The login of the connected user.
 $pluginsObject
 Array pointing to all loaded auth plugins.
 $eh
 This points to the error handler.
 $authMethod
 Plugin that was used to authenticate the user.

Detailed Description

This class does all the authentfication job.

This class will manage authentification, sessions, disconnection, auth plugins, etc... You only need to instanciate it, and use its showBox() method wherever you want the auth form to appear !

Member Function Documentation

AU_auth::__construct (  $  pluginPath  ) 
 

The constructor handles automatically all the autentification and session stuff so there is no need to call anything else than AU_Auth::showBox().

Parameters:
$pluginPath Path to the auth plugins directory. Each plugin must have a subdirectory of its own.
Todo:
Modify this class to force the auth plugins to implement a plugin template.

Work on the return values !

AU_auth::autoAuth (   )  [protected]
 

Try to automatically authenticate against all plugin that support autoAuth (like Cas, Ssl), that is, that can authenticate the user without providing login/password.

Returns:
true if the auth succeeded for at least one plugin, false otherwise.

AU_auth::connect (  $  userName  )  [protected]
 

Saves the "connected" state and username in session vars The user will remain logged in until the disconnect() method is used.

Parameters:
$userName The name of the authenticated user to save.

AU_auth::loadPlugins (  $  pluginPath  )  [protected]
 

Loads all the auth plugins and stores them into a member array, in order to call them when needed (Typically in the validate() method).

Parameters:
$pluginPath Path to the auth plugins directory. Each one is in a subdirectory of its own.
Returns:
True if succedeed, false instead.
Todo:
get the return value of the PG_object to return false if the instanciation failed !

Definition at line 177 of file libAuth.php.

Referenced by __construct().

AU_auth::showBox (   ) 
 

Shows the authentification box, use it where you need it in the page.

This should be the only method you need to call to run authentification, apart from instanciating this class. The output is not echoed, but returned, in order to ease differed display.

Returns:
A string containing the form to display, for use with echo().

AU_auth::validate (  $  login,
$  password
)  [protected]
 

Actually does the authentification, calling all the plugins until one recognizes the user, then store its name to later use it to disconnect the user.

Parameters:
$login The login, should come from the auth form.
$password The password, sould too come from the form.
Returns:
True is the user authenticated sucessfully, false instead.
